questions.question: Who is Apollo's twin sister in Greek mythology?
What instrument is Apollo famously associated with?
Which of the following is a key role of Apollo in Greek mythology?
options: B) God of the sun and music

questions.question: Who did Apollo fall in love with, but was tragically rejected?
What prophecy does Apollo give in the myth of Oedipus?
options: B) The fate of the city of Thebes
C) The murder of his father
D) The murder of his mother

questions.question: Apollo was the leader of which group of goddesses known for their connection to music and the arts?
Which creature did Apollo slay at Delphi to establish his temple?
Apollo had a son, Asclepius, who was known for which of the following?
Apollo is often depicted as riding a chariot across the sky. What is the significance of this imagery?
options: A) He brings light and warmth
B) He is the god of storms
D) He travels to the underworld
